Classroom Coaching Classic CBSE XI (Science)

Course Briefing.

The course has been designed for the the students who want to achieve high percentages in Class XII CBSE Board Exams. The classroom program is also beneficial for the students, who are preparing for the competitive examinations but, at the same time, want to keep an eye on the preparation for board exam.
The Course Highlights are:

Daily Assignments

  • Lecture Supplements
  • Home Assignments

Modular/Full Tests
The students can take tests in three formats:

  • Topic Specific Tests
  • Modular Tests (based on a group of topics)
  • Full Tests

Course Material

  • Complete NCERT covered
  • Separate section for Proofs and Derivations

Practical Facility

  • The students can practice attempting Experiments in well equipped laboratories

The methodology of teaching at domain E includes:

Lectures

Lectures at domain E will be targeting complete syllabus of Class XII CBSE Board Examination based on the NCERT Textbooks. The students will also be made to learn how to present the Proofs and Derivations required for the final CBSE Examination.

Assignments

Lecture Supplements: The solved examples to be attempted by the students are a part of Lecture Supplements.
Home Assignment: Along with Lecture Supplements few selected problems will be given to the students as home assignment.

Course Material

domain E will be providing complete reference material - 'Conquer CBSE'. This course material has now attained the status of being the 'perfect material' for CBSE preparation. The students would be given course material which has:

  • Complete NCERT problems covered.
  • Separate section for Proofs and Derivations.
  • CBSE XII Board Exams 10 year questions segregated topic wise.

Periodic Tests

Tests will be conducted periodically on each topic or a group of topics. These tests are important for the students for understanding the pattern of the exam. It will also help the students being in touch with CBSE preparation throughout the year. The students can take tests in three formats:

  • Topic Specific Tests
  • Modular Tests (based on a group of topics)
  • Full Tests (tests on full course)

Subjects

  • Physics
  • Chemistry
  • Mathematics/Biology
  • English.

Course Duration

  • 6-7 Months

Schedule of Test

  • Periodic (Tests can be taken even after completion of the course i.e. till Feb 2019)
